supporting_text: The Strategy adopts a whole of Government, a whole of society and a comprehensive One Health Approach to AMR, recognizing the complexity of the issue.
The Strategy includes specific actions in the human health sector, including improved surveillance, stewardship measures for the proper use of antibiotics, and infection prevention and control.
The Strategy outlines interventions to address AMR in Animal Health, including surveillance and education.
The Strategy includes actions targeting environmental aspects of AMR, including monitoring of antimicrobial residues in the environment.
The Strategy emphasizes the need for improved hygiene standards in farms to prevent cross-transmission of animal pathogens.
Implementation and evaluation of the Strategy will be supported by an Implementation Plan that provides the detail of specific actions, targets, time frames and indicators.
The Strategy aims to set and monitor qualitative and quantitative targets for improvement of prescribing at national level.
The Strategy includes actions to establish a comprehensive programme for at-source monitoring of antimicrobial residues in food animals and the environment.
The document mentions that the NAC is limited in its output due to lack of adequate resources both financial and human.
There is no mention of an assessment of future budget requirements for the activities listed.
The National Antibiotic Committee (NAC) serves as the Intersectoral Coordinating Mechanism for Malta.
The Strategy aims to review current relevant legislation to strengthen governance to prevent and counteract AMR.
The Strategy includes actions to enhance knowledge and awareness on AMR among healthcare and veterinary professionals and to include topics on AMR in the curricula of primary and secondary schools.
The Strategy mentions the need for awareness and education campaigns to inform the public about AMR and appropriate antibiotic use.
The Strategy emphasizes the importance of international partnerships and collaboration on regional and global efforts to respond to AMR.
The Strategy includes actions to strengthen surveillance systems of antibiotic resistance and establish a nationally representative and coordinated programme for surveillance of antimicrobial usage.
The Strategy aims to strengthen relevant surveillance and feedback systems on antibiotic use and resistance in human and animal health as well as the environment.
The Strategy includes improving infection prevention and control measures across Human Health and Animal Health settings.
The Strategy aligns with the WHO Global Action Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance and the EU Action Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance.
The Strategy includes actions to introduce appropriate legislation to establish minimum standards for infection prevention and control in Human Healthcare and residential care institutions.
The Strategy aims to implement effective One Health antimicrobial stewardship practices across Human and Animal Health settings to ensure appropriate and prudent prescribing.
The Strategy includes actions to agree on a national research agenda and promote investment to prevent, detect and contain antimicrobial resistance.
